preibisch_imagej.widget

Class HistogramBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • preibisch_imagej.widget.HistogramBundle

  • public class HistogramBundle
extends Object
    HistogramBundles marry a list of Histogram1ds with addtional rendering information.
    Author:
    Barry DeZonia

      • HistogramBundle

        public HistogramBundle(Histogram1d<?> hist)

    • Method Detail

      • hasChanges

        public boolean hasChanges()
        Returns true if the bundle has been changed via use of some of the field setting api. This information can be used by renderers to update their UI as appropriate. Note one can also force the change flag via setHasChanges().

      • setHasChanges

        public void setHasChanges(boolean val)
        Sets the changes flag. Called by renderers after they have updated their UI to reflect previous changes.

      • getHistogramCount

        public int getHistogramCount()
        Returns the total number of histograms contained in this bundle.

      • setHistogram

        public void setHistogram(int index,
                         Histogram1d<?> hist)
        Sets the histogram of interest for this HistogramBundle.

      • getHistogram

        public Histogram1d<?> getHistogram(int index)
        Gets the histogram of interest for this HistogramBundle.

      • setMinBin

        public void setMinBin(long min)
        Sets the bin number of the minimum value. Can be used to by renderers to display the minimum line on the histogram for example. A value of -1 notes that the minimum value is not of interest.

      • getMinBin

        public long getMinBin()
        Gets the bin number of the minimum value. A value of -1 notes the minimum value is not of interest.

      • setMaxBin

        public void setMaxBin(long max)
        Sets the bin number of the maximum value. Can be used to by renderers to display the maximum line on the histogram for example. A value of -1 notes that the maximum value is not of interest.

      • getMaxBin

        public long getMaxBin()
        Gets the bin number of the maximum value. A value of -1 notes the maximum value is not of interest.

      • setPreferredSize

        public void setPreferredSize(int x,
                             int y)
        Sets the preferred size for the rendering of this histogram as a widget.

      • getPreferredSizeX

        public int getPreferredSizeX()
        Gets the preferred X size of the widget for the rendering of this histogram.

      • getPreferredSizeY

        public int getPreferredSizeY()
        Gets the preferred Y size of the widget for the rendering of this histogram.

      • setLineSlopeIntercept

        public void setLineSlopeIntercept(double slope,
                                  double intercept)
        Sets the line equation for the slope line of a histogram.

      • getLineSlope

        public double getLineSlope()
        Gets the line equation slope.

      • getLineIntercept

        public double getLineIntercept()
        Gets the line equation intercept. The scale is 1.0 for whole height of the plot. This does NOT mean that value must be between 0 and 1. Intercepts can go outside range of table height.

      • setDataMinMax

        public void setDataMinMax(double min,
                          double max)
        Sets the min/max values of the actual range.

      • getDataMin

        public double getDataMin()
        Gets the minimum value of the actual data range.

      • getDataMax

        public double getDataMax()
        Gets the maximum value of the actual data range.

      • setTheoreticalMinMax

        public void setTheoreticalMinMax(double min,
                                 double max)
        Sets the min/max values of the desired range.

      • getTheoreticalMin

        public double getTheoreticalMin()
        Gets the minimum value of the desired range.

      • getTheoreticalMax

        public double getTheoreticalMax()
        Gets the maximum value of the desired range.
